snippet: The Olympics, with its long history of doping, would seem to be the last event an expert on performance-enhancing drugs would want to watch.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column notes that Charles Yesalis, who spent nearly 30 years examining the dark side of sports, exploring firsthand the lengths to which athletes will go to get an edge, still enjoys watching the Olympics, despite its long history of doping.
lead_paragraph: The Olympics, with its long history of doping, would seem to be the last event an expert on performance-enhancing drugs would want to watch.

headline.print_headline: Enjoying the Games, Despite What May Be Behind the Curtain
